page.title: 06HOUSING & LAW-BEDWORTH
page.content: Bedworth has accommodation for the elderly & some nursing homes.One example is{John Hayes Court}.Opened in 1962 it houses 30 elderly people.Most residents are over 80 yrs old.The flats contain a living room & kitchen with a shared bathroom.The ladies enjoy knitting but not television,& Bingo games are played occasionally. The residents are supervised by a full time Warden.They live in a happy atmosphere. {Police Station}.Built in 1911.Employs 80 people,including uniformed officers & plain clothes C.I.D.,with typists & clerks dealing in administration.24 hr service is provided.Work involves general enquiries,burglaries,road accidents,shop lifting & social disturbances.Crime prevention is important.2 trained Police dogs are used in Bedworth.
